page.title: 01Gazetteer Page
page.content: The area is situated to the North of Portsmouth. It is largely residential with a mixture of open space and farm land. Portsdown Hill runs through the centre from East to West rising steeply from sea level in the south to 100m, the land then rapidly dips back to 30m above sea level. The Portsmouth/Widley boundary is to the North of the hill. In the South a main railway line crosses the area. Residential accomodation consists of council and private housing. The area includes a large modern hospital complex, the U.K. headquarters of an international company, two Victorian forts, some local shopping areas, a contoversial modern housing development and a unique viewpoint on the hilltop giving panoramic views.
